You can create an AbandonedBaby Candlestick Pattern indicator that requires manual update The following reference table describes the AbandonedBaby constructor.

AbandonedBaby()1/3

            AbandonedBaby QuantConnect.Indicators.AbandonedBaby (
     string    name,
     *decimal  penetration,
   )

Initializes a new instance of the AbandonedBaby class using the specified name.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
*decimal penetration Percentage of penetration of a candle within another candle.

Return

AbandonedBaby - The new AbandonedBaby indicator object.

Definition at line 79 of file CandlestickPatterns/AbandonedBaby.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;

private AbandonedBaby _abandonedbaby;

// In Initialize()
_abandonedbaby = new AbandonedBaby(name, penetration);
_abandonedbaby.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _abandonedbaby, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_abandonedbaby.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _abandonedbaby.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import AbandonedBaby
    
# In Initialize()
self.abandonedbaby = AbandonedBaby(name, penetration)
self.abandonedbaby.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.abandonedbaby, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.abandonedbaby.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.abandonedbaby.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

using QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns;
    
private AbandonedBaby _abandonedbaby;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_abandonedbaby = new AbandonedBaby(penetration);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _abandonedbaby.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_abandonedbaby.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _abandonedbaby.Current.Value;
}
from QuantConnect.Indicators.CandlestickPatterns import AbandonedBaby
    
# In Initialize()
self.abandonedbaby = AbandonedBaby(penetration)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.abandonedbaby.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.abandonedbaby.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.abandonedbaby.Current.Value
